capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Flitwick's role as a professor and his mantra. It seems to me that he really embodies the idea of being a dedicated teacher and mentor. I mean, who else can say they're both a professor and have a title like "mantra-professor"? (laughs) But seriously, it's clear that he takes his job very seriously and is committed to helping his students grow and learn.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I've always been fascinated by the concept of a title, and Flitwick's mantra as a professor is really inspiring. I mean, "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live" - it's such a great reminder to stay grounded and focused on what's important. The way he carries himself with confidence and wisdom is truly admirable.
